title: Canva claims $4.7b valuation after seventh raising
text:
The paper billionaire status of Canva co-founders and engaged couple Melanie Perkins and Cliff Obrecht appears to have been cemented by a seventh venture capital raising for the graphic design platform.

The $125 million injection into the software-as-a-service provider announced on Thursday values Canva at $4.7 billion, it said, up from the $3.6 billion valuation it claimed following a $70 million raising in May.

Canva co-founders Cliff Obrecht (left) Melanie Perkins and Cameron Adams. Supplied

The latest raise includes new money from California's Bessemer Venture Partners, and follow-on funding from Massachusetts-based General Catalyst, Australia's Blackbird Ventures, Sequoia China, and the Bond Capital vehicle of former Morgan Stanley technology analyst Mary Meeker.

Canva has now raised a total of $333 million since it was founded in 2014, and claims more than 15 million users for its products, most of whom are on the free tier allowing the creation of greeting cards, posters, websites and presentation slides.

Ms Perkins, 33, and Mr Obrecht, 32, are set to appear on next week's Financial Review Young Rich List of Australia's wealthiest people aged under 40, with a valuation of $1.35 billion based on the May fundraising.
description: The graphic design platform's founding couple are set to debut as billionaires on next week's Young Rich List.
